</gmd:otherCitationDetails>             </gmd:CI_Citation>          </gmd:citation>          <gmd:abstract>             <gco:CharacterString>A Hydrologic Area of Concern (HAC) is a land area surrounding a water source, which is intended to include the portion of the watershed in which land uses are likely to have the greatest impact on water quality at the water supply intake.</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:abstract>          <gmd:purpose>             <gco:CharacterString>The HACs are used to rate the vulnerability of the water supply source.</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:purpose>          <gmd:status>             <gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList="http://www.isotc211.org/2005/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode" The information provided in this coverage is a subset of spatial databases developed by the New Hampshire Department of Environmental Services (NHDES). Development of these databases is an ongoing project; they may not contain all existing and potential sites, stations, or threats. The NHDES is not responsible for the use or interpretation of this information, or for any inaccuracies in the site names, tax map and lot information, or locations. All information is subject to verification. These data are to be used for planning purposes only; distribution is discouraged.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:otherConstraints>             </gmd:MD_LegalConstraints>          </gmd:resourceConstraints>          <gmd:resourceConstraints>             <gmd:MD_LegalConstraints>                <gmd:accessConstraints>                   <gmd:MD_RestrictionCode codeList="http://www.isotc211.org/2005/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_RestrictionCode"                                           codeListValue="otherRestrictions">otherRestrictions</gmd:MD_RestrictionCode>                </gmd:accessConstraints>                <gmd:otherConstraints>                   <gco:CharacterString>Access Constraints: Upon NHDES Approval</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:otherConstraints>             </gmd:MD_LegalConstraints>          </gmd:resourceConstraints>          <gmd:spatialRepresentationType>             <gmd:MD_SpatialRepresentationTypeCode codeList="http://www.isotc211.org/2005/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_SpatialRepresentationTypeCode"                                                   codeListValue="vector">vector</gmd:MD_SpatialRepresentationTypeCode>          </gmd:spatialRepresentationType>          <gmd:language>             <gco:CharacterString>eng; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.0.0.535</gco:CharacterString>          </gmd:environmentDescription>          <gmd:extent>             <gmd:EX_Extent id="boundingExtent">                <gmd:geographicElement>                   <gmd:EX_GeographicBoundingBox id="boundingGeographicBoundingBox">                      <gmd:westBoundLongitude>                         <gco:Decimal>-72.509738</gco:Decimal>                      </gmd:westBoundLongitude>                      <gmd:eastBoundLongitude>                         <gco:Decimal>-70.784543</gco:Decimal>                      </gmd:eastBoundLongitude>                      <gmd:southBoundLatitude>                         <gco:Decimal>42.768370</gco:Decimal>                      </gmd:southBoundLatitude>                      <gmd:northBoundLatitude>                         <gco:Decimal>44.807722</gco:Decimal>                      </gmd:northBoundLatitude>                   </gmd:EX_GeographicBoundingBox>                </gmd:geographicElement>                <gmd:temporalElement>                   <gmd:EX_TemporalExtent id="boundingTemporalExtent">                      <gmd:extent>                         <gml:TimePeriod gml:id="d1489e43">                            <gml:beginPosition>1999-01-01</gml:beginPosition>                            <gml:endPosition>2002-01-01</gml:endPosition>                         </gml:TimePeriod>                      </gmd:extent>                   </gmd:EX_TemporalExtent>                </gmd:temporalElement>             </gmd:EX_Extent>          </gmd:extent>       </gmd:MD_DataIdentification>    </gmd:identificationInfo>    <gmd:contentInfo><!-- translated from eainfo/detailed to MD_CoverageDescription--><gmd:MD_CoverageDescription>          <gmd:attributeDescription gco:nilReason="unknown"/>          <gmd:contentType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>          <!--FGDC content not mapped to ISO. From Xpath: //enttyp--><!--<enttyp>             <enttypl>hacs_p</enttypl>             <enttypd>The presence, absence, density, and/or proximity to surface water of various land uses in the HAC are used to rate the vulnerability of the water supply source.  Land use information for this assessment process came from two sources: existing GIS coverages and an on-the-ground "windshield survey" of all or part of each HAC.  A HAC is intended to include that portion of the watershed in which land uses are likely to have the greatest impact on water quality at the water supply intake.  Therefore, each HAC needs to be large enough to include land uses that may potentially threaten the water supply source, but not so large as to give the water supply a "high" vulnerability rating for a few potential contamination sources located far from the water supply intake in a large watershed.</enttypd>             <enttypds>NHDES</enttypds>          </enttyp>--><gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>FID</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>Internal feature number.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>                <!--FGDC content not mapped to ISO. From Xpath: //attrdomv/udom--><!--<udom>Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom>--></gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>Shape</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>Feature geometry.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>                <!--FGDC content not mapped to ISO. From Xpath: //attrdomv/udom--><!--<udom>Coordinates defining the features.</udom>--></gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>AREA</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>Area of HAC in square feet.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>                <!--FGDC content not mapped to ISO. From Xpath: //attrdomv/udom--><!--<udom>Calculated value by ArcInfo.</udom>--></gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>PERIMETER</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>Perimeter of HAC in feet.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>                <!--FGDC content not mapped to ISO. From Xpath: //attrdomv/udom--><!--<udom>Calculated value by ArcInfo.</udom>--></gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>PWSID</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>Combined System-Source/Entity ID. The first 7-digit number of the Public Water System (PWS) ID is generated by NHDES's Water Supply Engineering Bureau staff. The three digits following the PWS ID identify sources and/or entities attached to the PWS.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>                <!--FGDC content not mapped to ISO. From Xpath: //attrdomv/udom--><!--<udom>Concatenated ID constructed by NHDES.</udom>--></gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>PWSID2</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>In some areas, HACs overlapped one another, thus the polygons and/or arcs were coded with all of the appropriate system IDs. This will be resolved when the coverage gets built with region topology, providing one feature (i.e. region) per HAC.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>                <!--FGDC content not mapped to ISO. From Xpath: //attrdomv/udom--><!--<udom>Determined by NHDES.</udom>--></gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>PWSID3</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>In some areas, HACs overlapped one another, thus the polygons and/or arcs were coded with all of the appropriate system IDs. This will be resolved when the coverage gets built with region topology, providing one feature (i.e. region) per HAC.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>                <!--FGDC content not mapped to ISO. From Xpath: //attrdomv/udom--><!--<udom>Determined by NHDES.</udom>--></gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>ALLID</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>Combination of all of the PWSIDs that apply to the area.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>                <!--FGDC content not mapped to ISO. From Xpath: //attrdomv/udom--><!--<udom>Determined by NHDES.</udom>--></gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>SYS_NAME</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>The name of the water system.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>                <!--FGDC content not mapped to ISO. From Xpath: //attrdomv/udom--><!--<udom>The name of the system as registered with NHDES.</udom>--></gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>          <gmd:dimension>             <gmd:MD_Band>                <gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                   <gco:MemberName>                      <gco:aName>                         <gco:CharacterString>SRC_DESC</gco:CharacterString>                      </gco:aName>                      <gco:attributeType gco:nilReason="unknown"/>                   </gco:MemberName>                </gmd:sequenceIdentifier>                <gmd:descriptor>                   <gco:CharacterString>Description of the water source.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:descriptor>                <!--FGDC content not mapped to ISO. From Xpath: //attrdomv/udom--><!--<udom>Set by NHDES.</udom>--></gmd:MD_Band>          </gmd:dimension>       </gmd:MD_CoverageDescription>    </gmd:contentInfo>    <gmd:contentInfo><!-- translated <gmd:distributionOrderProcess>                   <gmd:MD_StandardOrderProcess>                      <gmd:fees>                         <gco:CharacterString>No Fee for standard export</gco:CharacterString>                      </gmd:fees>                      <gmd:orderingInstructions>                         <gco:CharacterString>Ordering Instructions: Most coverages are available through ftp site (see Online Linkage). To address homeland security concerns, access to some of these data sets is available only to users who present a valid personal identification number (PIN) and password. These data sets have an access constraint set to Upon NHDES Approval. Users can apply for a PIN and password using the OneStop Data Retrieval Registration Form (http://www.des.state.nh.us/gis/onestop/). Applicants should be very specific when providing information on the registration form to enable NHDES personnel to determine their eligibility. For more information on what criteria is necessary to receive a PIN/password please visit http://www.des.state.nh.us/factsheets/co/co-14.htm. Once the applicant has been provided a PIN/Password, the applicant shall be the sole responsible party for the information they receive using the PIN/Password that has been issued to said party. The applicant shall be responsible for the accuracy of the information submitted in a request for a PIN and Password that will allow said applicant to access certain information held by the Department of Environmental Services. The applicant shall understand by submitting a registration form, said applicant shall be responsible for the PIN and Password they receive and for any and all information collected using the PIN and Password, and that NO LIABILITY IS INCURRED BY THE STATE by reason of providing the requested access.</gco:CharacterString>                      </gmd:orderingInstructions>                   </gmd:MD_StandardOrderProcess>                </gmd:distributionOrderProcess>             </gmd:MD_Distributor>          </gmd:distributor>          <gmd:transferOptions>             <gmd:MD_DigitalTransferOptions>                <gmd:transferSize>                   <gco:Real>0.497</gco:Real>                </gmd:transferSize>                <gmd:onLine>                   <gmd:CI_OnlineResource>                      <gmd:linkage>                         <gmd:URL>http://www.des.state.nh.us/</gmd:URL>                      </gmd:linkage>                   </gmd:CI_OnlineResource>                </gmd:onLine>             </gmd:MD_DigitalTransferOptions>          </gmd:transferOptions>       </gmd:MD_Distribution>    </gmd:distributionInfo>    <gmd:dataQualityInfo>       <gmd:DQ_DataQuality>          <gmd:scope>             <gmd:DQ_Scope>                <gmd:level>                   <gmd:MD_ScopeCode codeList="http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/metadata/published/xsd/schema/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode"                                     codeListValue="dataset">dataset</gmd:MD_ScopeCode>                </gmd:level>             </gmd:DQ_Scope>          </gmd:scope>          <gmd:report>             <gmd:DQ_CompletenessCommission>                <gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                   <gco:CharacterString>The data is complete as of publication date. Where topography does not indicate a definitive divide the larger area is included e.g., where a wetland is located in a saddle between two ridges the watershed delineation includes all of the wetland. The HAC database may be updated as watershed boundaries, time-of-travel, or buffer distances are adjusted or updated.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>             </gmd:DQ_CompletenessCommission>          </gmd:report>          <gmd:report>             <gmd:DQ_CompletenessOmission>                <gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                   <gco:CharacterString>The data is complete as of publication date. Where topography does not indicate a definitive divide the larger area is included e.g., where a wetland is located in a saddle between two ridges the watershed delineation includes all of the wetland. The HAC database may be updated as watershed boundaries, time-of-travel, or buffer distances are adjusted or updated.</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:evaluationMethodDescription>                <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>             </gmd:DQ_CompletenessOmission>          </gmd:report>          <gmd:report>             <gmd:DQ_ConceptualConsistency>                <gmd:measureDescription>                   <gco:CharacterString>Where applicable HAC boundaries where compared with USGS 7.5' topographic map contours and NRCS hydrologic unit boundaries (HUC).</gco:CharacterString>                </gmd:measureDescription>                <gmd:result gco:nilReason="unknown"/>             </gmd:DQ_ConceptualConsistency>          </gmd:report>          <gmd:lineage>             <gmd:LI_Lineage>                <gmd:processStep>                   <gmi:LE_ProcessStep>                      <gmd:description>                         <gco:CharacterString>A variety of methods were used to delineate the HACs. For sources with small and/or undeveloped watersheds, the entire watershed is the HAC. For lakes, reservoirs, etc. with large, developed watersheds, the HAC is the direct watershed (that portion of the watershed that does not drain to a major wetland or impoundment before flowing to the source), except in two cases involving very large lakes, the HAC is the direct watershed for the bay where the intake is located. For rivers with large, developed watersheds, the HACs were delineated on the basis of time of travel, direct watersheds, buffer zones, or some combination thereof. A few HACs for large sources were delineated to include high-priority sub-watersheds identified by individual studies.</gco:CharacterString>                      </gmd:description>                      <gmd:dateTime>                         <gco:DateTime>2002-01-01T00:00:00</gco:DateTime>                      </gmd:dateTime>                   </gmi:LE_ProcessStep>                </gmd:processStep>             </gmd:LI_Lineage>          </gmd:lineage>       </gmd:DQ_DataQuality>    </gmd:dataQualityInfo>    <gmd:metadataMaintenance>       <gmd:MD_MaintenanceInformation>
